title: David Beckham takes his kids to see LA Galaxy tribute statue for the first time
text:
He was honoured by his former-team, LA Galaxy, in March, when they unveiled a statue of him at the Legends Plaza in Carson, California.

And on Saturday night, David Beckham took his four children to finally see the effigy, rounding off the family's half-term jaunt in Los Angeles.

The clan - including Victoria - went for a swanky meal, before heading over to the Dignity Health Sports Park where the statue of David, striking a football, has been erected.

Proud moment: David Beckham took his four children to finally see the statue of him at the Legends Plaza in Carson, California on Saturday night, rounding off the family's half-term jaunt in Los Angeles

Filming the moment on Instagram Stories, David asked children Brooklyn, 20, Romeo, 17, Cruz, 14, and Harper, eight, whether they thought his 'bum was big', prompting a giggle from Harper.

The boys seemed in awe, uttering 'so cool' and 'that's pretty sick', as dad David, 44, pointed their names etched into the football boots on the carving.

Victoria, 45, also uploaded snaps of the moment to her social media, exclaiming how proud they all are of David.

Earlier in the evening, the family were seen leaving Giorgio - a swanky LA eatery.

Earlier in the evening: The family were seen leaving Giorgio - a swanky LA eatery

Out with dad: David went smart-casual in a navy shirt and dark slacks and Harper wore a sun dress

Trio: The Beckham sons went for their usual trendy attire

Finally: It's taken over six months for the children to finally get around to visiting the statue of their sports star father

Victoria looked chic in a snakeskin dress and purple heels from her own fashion brand and her trademark shades.

David went smart-casual in a navy shirt and dark slacks, Harper wore a sun dress, and the trio of Beckham sons went for their usual trendy attire.

It's taken over six months for the children to finally get around to visiting the statue of their sports star father.

In March, David attended the LA Galaxy's 2-1 win over the Chicago Fire on the opening day of the 2019 MLS season, when the statue was unveiled, alongside his wife.

The former England captain played for LA Galaxy between 2007 and 2012 during the twilight years of his stellar career, leading them to two championships, and he is still held in high regard in California.

The big reveal: In March, David attended the LA Galaxy's 2-1 win over the Chicago Fire on the opening day of the 2019 MLS season, when the statue was unveiled

A proud chapter: The former England captain played for LA Galaxy between 2007 and 2012

Unveiling: Victoria joined him for the momentous occasion

During a speech, Beckham insisted he wanted to help the American league grow and insisted there is still 'a long way to go'.

He said: 'My commitment to this league and country was always a lot more than on the field,' Beckham said as he addressed the crowd.

'I wanted to grow the game and play a small part in growing this league and making it bigger. I think we have been successful but there still is a long way to go but I think we are very happy with the growth over the past 10 years.'

Beckham's signing in 2007 gave higher prominence to the league internationally as more top players arrived and fan interest increased.

Speech: Beckham insisted he wanted to help the American league grow

Support: He stuck around to watch his old club beat the Chicago Fire on the opening day of the season

'No doubt our league wouldn't be what it is today if David didn't make that decision,' MLS commissioner Don Garber added. 'At that time we were a fledgling business and trying to figure out if soccer would make it in America. His signing told the world that Major League Soccer could be the league of choice.'

Beckham admitted he felt a little sheepish to be the subject of the Galaxy's first statue in their legends plaza, which is located outside their stadium's main entrance.

The artists responsible for capturing the essence of the former Galaxy, Real Madrid and Manchester United star were Julie and Omri Amrany.
description: David Beckham took his four children to finally see the statue of him at the Legends Plaza in Carson, California on Saturday night, rounding off the family's half-term jaunt in Los Angeles.
